## A+ Grading Eligibility Checklist

The following goals were agreed upon on **February 19** as required elements for earning an **A+** in the final project for the *Digital Dairy Management and Data Analytics* course (Instructor: M. Hostens).

At the end of the course—after the final presentation with the farm manager —these checkboxes can be validated.

| Requirement | Completed? | By when |
|-----------------------------------|:---------------------------------:|--|
| Data agreement in place and signed by all parties | ☐ | February 19th 2026 |
| Data quality (including inventory check) | ☐ | February 19th 2026 |
| Dataset organized | ☐ | March 1st 2026 |
| Questions\* defined | ☐ | March 15th 2026 |
| Presentation | ☐ |  |
| Action plan in place | ☐ |  |
| Peer feedback the day after the presentation | ☐ |  |
| When the farm manager questions\* are all answered | ☐ |  |

------------------------------------------------------------------------

### \*Questions from the farm manager

-   Milk production (defined on ...)

    -   Long term milk yield analysis, including components, and analysis for a seasonal effect

    -   Do changes in components compensate

    -   Heifer production trend

    -   Lactation curve per parity

    -   Tie stall vs free stalls

    -   Difference from herd mates

-   Inventory clarifications:

    -   Calves

    -   Milk cows

    -   Replacement rate

    -   Is the herd actually shrinking

    -   Death loss

        -   What’s going on?

-   Reproduction

    -   TBD

### Notes

-   This table should be reviewed jointly by the team, the farmer(s), and Professor Hostens following the final presentation.
-   The checklist is meant to support transparency, self‑reflection, and assessment alignment.
